statement.tex: %text If a matrix has $5$ elements, write all the possible orders it can have. %

step.context: %text If the five elements are $a$, $b$, $c$, $d$ and $e$, which of the following configurations form valid matrices? % \overbrace{\left[\begin{array}{ccc} a & b & c \\ d & e & \end{array}\right]}^A \overbrace{\left[\begin{array}{ccccc} a & b & c & d & e \end{array}\right] }^B \overbrace{\left[\begin{array}{c} a \\ b \\ c \\ d \\ e \end{array}\right]}^C \\
step.reason: %text In a valid matrix, all of the rows must have equal number of elements and all of the columns must also have equal number of elements. Therefore, the only valid matrices that can be formed using $5$ elements are $1\times 5$ and $5\times 1$. %
